result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Patrick Brown

defendant.name: Brown, Michael Patrick
defendant.address: 8719 West Lapham Street, #4, West Allis, WI 53214

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Patrick Brown in court.  Attorney Jacob Manian in court for Michael Patrick Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Sara Sadowksi. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Letter to Court, with attached email from The Alma Center

Court authorizes defendant to be present for the birth of his child. Court authorizes NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim AFTER defendant has completed 10 BIP sessions and provided proof to the state and the Court.

Defendant Michael Patrick Brown in court with attorney Jacob Manian.  Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Per state's motion, victim is requesting modification of no contact order. Court holds colloquy with victim. Court hears arguments.  For reasons as set forth, Court authorizes defendant to be present for the birth of his child. Court authorizes NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim AFTER defendant has completed 10 BIP sessions and provided proof to the state and the Court. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jacob Manian in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Court is in trial on another case and is unable to proceed on this matter. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court authorizes defendant to attend medical appointments electronically (zoom, facetime, or speaker phone) only. Parties are not to discuss the case.

Per state's motion, victim is requesting modification of no contact order. Court holds colloquy with victim. Court hears argument.  For reasons as set forth, Court authorizes defendant to attend medical appointments electronically (zoom, facetime, or speaker phone) only. Parties are not to discuss the case.

Defendant Michael Patrick Brown in court with attorney Jacob Manian.  Gerald Henry Alder on behalf of Sara Sadowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 35.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Michael Patrick Brown in court with attorney Jacob Manian.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Court hears arguments as to bail. Court holds colloquy with the victim. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court DENIES defense's motion to modify bail. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 039630,
Payable Number: 1001933,
Receipt Number: 22RP016681,
Amount: $20.00

Remaining cash bail posted to be returned to the remitter.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AEH and MH
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Michael Patrick Brown in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 35.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
